results.title: Weaving linen
results.brief_description: A general account of modern factory methods of weaving linen. The following processes are illustrated: preparing the weft yarn for the shuttle; preparing the warp; threading the heddles; weaving the linen; and the finish processes including pre-shrinking, scalding, bleaching and dyeing, calendering and folding. An animated diagram is used to explain how the loom works.

An animated diagram is used to explain how the loom works.

results.title: Weaving
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Illustrates how weaving is a practical craft, vital to the survival of the Pushtu tribe. Shows how the Pushtu women work on old, crude portable wooden looms. This program has no dialogue but a soundtrack.

results.title: Weave me a rainbow
results.creator_credit: Edward McConnell, Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: Wool is born, not made. The dyeing and weaving of wool in Scotland, in colors and textures inspired by Scotland’s own landscape, and the production of fine woollen cloth form the main theme of the film.

results.title: Weatherwise
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The weather affects man in every phase of his living. To learn what the weather will be, weather reports from all over the continent are sent to the Weather Bureau where they are plotted on to maps. From these a daily weather forecast is made.

results.title: Weather: understanding storms
results.brief_description: Shows how temperature, pressure and moisture interact to bring about various types of storms, including thunderstorm, tornado, hurricane, blizzard, dust storm. Describes characteristics of each. Emphasises increasingly important role of meteorology and weather satellites in forecasting storms.

results.title: Weather: understanding precipitation
results.brief_description: Use of cloud photography and animation to explain relative humidity, dew point, types of clouds, and why various kinds of preciipitaiton occur. Explains precipitation in terms of water and temperature. Classifies clouds according to how they are formed and according to their altitudes.

results.title: Weather satellites
results.brief_description: Explains the importance of weather satellites in recording and relaying pictures of wind and cloud patterns to strategically located receiving stations, thereby enabling meteorologists to spot the early formation of dangerous conditions such as typhoons, hurricanes and tornadoes.
results.description: Explains the importance of weather satellites in recording and relaying pictures of wind and cloud patterns to strategically located receiving stations, thereby enabling meteorologists to spot the early formation of dangerous conditions such as typhoons, hurricanes and tornadoes.

results.title: Weather forecast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
International cooperation in weather forecasting. Radio communications system controlled by the World Meteorological Organisation of the United Nations. Numerous examples of how weather forecasting can reduce or eliminate the danger and damage of hurricanes, gales and high tides. Weather studies in the reclamation of desert areas.

results.title: Wear resistant metals
results.creator_credit: Peter Bruce, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Between two and four hundred million dollars are spent in Australia each year on replacing metal equipment work by abrasion, impact and erosion. One way of preventing wear is by coating metal components with wear-resistant alloys. The choice of the appropriate alloy is based on a thorough understanding of its performance in particular situations and the influence of temperature and corrosive environments on it.
